page.title: 17TEMATON/ST.ERNEY SUMMARY
page.content: This area has been farmed and worked since Anglo Saxon times,possibly even from the Bronze Age.In many ways it would seem to have changed little over the years,the noise of the quarry men blasting for slate has been replaced on occasions by the noise of the military testing their{explosives. There are fewer than{200 registered {electors}living in the area; they either work the land,commute to Saltash or Plymouth to work or they are retired.Nowhere in the area are you more than 30 minutes drive from the{Tamar Bridge}and yet it is a very quiet and private place seemingly content to let the rest of the world rush by.
